tool_description: MediaCrush makes sharing media super fast by reducing the file size, without sacrificing quality.  We'll losslessly compress images, video, and audio uploaded to our service.  We can get 1000-3000% faster for some files!
name: MediaCrush
title: MediaCrush

api_list.name: /api/<hash>/delete
api_list.description: Returns: a dictionary describing whether the delete operation succeeded. In most cases it is easier to check the HTTP status code.

api_list.name: /api/<hash>/status
api_list.description: Returns: the processing status of the file identified by <hash>.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com/LxqXxVPAvqqB/status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com/{hash}/status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /api/<hash>/exists
api_list.description: Returns: a dictionary answering the question of whether a hash exists.

api_list.name: /api/upload/url
api_list.description: Parameters: url, the URL from where to fetch the file to upload.  Returns: the same as /api/upload/file.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: the URL from where to fetch the file to upload.

api_list.name: /api/<hash>
api_list.description: Returns: information about the file whose hash is <hash>. When a file is uploaded to MediaCrush, several associated files may be generated. In the case of GIF files, two video files are generated - one with h.264/mpeg and another with theora/vorbis. Some media will also have "extra" files. In the case of uploaded videos, we'll include an image/png thumbnail file in the extras.
api_list.code:

url = "https://community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com/CPvuR5lRhmS0"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com/{hash}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-mediacrush.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /api/info
api_list.description: Returns: an array of file objects.
